intro: Linum corymbiferum var. munbyanum, commonly known as Munby's flax, is a variant of the flax plant native to the British Isles. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of blue or purple flowers that bloom in summer. The leaves are lance-shaped and hairy, contributing to its distinctive appearance. This plant thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. It is often found in grasslands and along woodland edges, where it plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
